text: Nikola Spasov (; 15 December 1958 – 23 November 2020) was a Bulgarian professional footballer and coach. Spasov played for PFC Lokomotiv Sofia, FC Dunav Ruse, PFC Cherno More Varna and PFC Spartak Varna in his country. Spasov moved to Portugal in December 1986, and remained in the nation for the following seven years, representing five teams. In the 1989–90 campaign he scored a career-best 34 goals for F.C. Paços de Ferreira. In June 1994, after one season in his homeland with former team Cherno More, Spasov retired from football at nearly 36 years of age. Spasov died on 23 November 2020 in Montana, Bulgaria from COVID-19 at the age of 61.Бывший тренер "Кызыл-Жар СК" скончался от коронавируса ==Honours== ===Player=== ;Lokomotiv Sofia *Bulgarian League: 1977–78 ===Manager=== ;Cherno More *Bulgarian Cup: 2014–15 *Bulgarian Supercup: 2015 ;Tsarsko Selo *Bulgarian Second League: 2018–19 ==References== Category:1958 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Bulgarian footballers Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Bulgaria
title: Nikola Spasov
